item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Cuts in humanitarian aid funding could expose up to 13.7 million people to extreme hunger around the world, the World Food Program (WFP) warned yesterday. “The humanitarian aid system is under severe pressure as partners withdraw from frontline areas, creating a void,” the Rome-based agency said in a new report titled “A lifebuoy in danger.” The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. In Portugal, he started working at Social Security, later moving to a clinical analysis laboratory. It was in this area that he developed his taste for gastronomy, not through work, but through various lunches and dinners in different restaurants. Increasingly interested in cooking, António decided to take a job, in 1984, in a restaurant, where he admitted to having learned to cook, according to an interview with the South China Morning Post newspaper, in 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recalls that the food and the show made the restaurant very famous, especially among Japanese, Korean and Hong Kong tourists. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. And this factor also contributed to the fact that António offered a glass of port wine at the end of the meal, which also led to the recognition of the Port Wine Confraternity. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: Chemistry | Nobel Prize for the development of metal-organic structures
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, from Kyoto University, Richard Robson, from the University of Melbourne, and Omar M. Yaghi, from the University of California, “for the development of metal-organic structures”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced yesterday. Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have developed a new form of molecular architecture – metal-organic frameworks – that can be used to collect water from desert air, capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyze chemical reactions. The three laureates created molecular constructs with large spaces through which gases and other chemicals could flow. The president of the Nobel Committee for Chemistry, Heiner Linque, highlighted precisely the fact that these “metal-organic structures have enormous potential, bringing previously unforeseen opportunities for personalized materials with new functions”. The research that led to the discovery of this new form of molecular architecture began nearly four decades ago, in 1989, when Richard Robson tested the use of the inherent properties of atoms by combining positively charged copper ions with a four-armed molecule. When combined, they bonded "to form a spacious, well-ordered crystal. It was like a diamond filled with countless cavities," the academy explains. Robson immediately realized the potential of his molecular construction, but it was still unstable and crumbled easily. It was chemists Susumu Kitagawa and Omar Yaghi who managed to provide a solid foundation for this construction method. Notable applications Following the discoveries of the three laureates, chemists built tens of thousands of different MOFs. Some of them could contribute to solving some of humanity's biggest challenges, with applications including breaking down traces of pharmaceuticals in the environment, capturing carbon dioxide or collecting water from desert air. The discovery also allows the separation of perfluoroalkylated and polyfluoroalkylated substances (PFAS) from water. PFAS are a group of synthetic chemical compounds known as “forever chemicals” due to their extreme persistence in the environment and in the human body. PFAS are used in a wide range of industrial and household products, such as stain- and water-resistant textiles, food packaging, non-stick cookware and firefighting foams. Its accumulation in the environment and potential health risks, including liver damage and other problems, have led to concerns and a search for safer alternatives.

item.title: Louvre | France to reinforce security at cultural sites after theft
item.description: The French Minister of Internal Affairs, Laurent Nuñez, will reinforce security measures in all cultural establishments, the press office announced yesterday, following a jewelry theft at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The decision was taken after a meeting with his government colleague in charge of Culture, Rachida Dati, said the same ministerial source, cited by the French news agency AFP. The institution, in the center of the French capital, remained closed yesterday, one day after a group, still at large, managed to steal multiple works of jewelry art. "The Louvre Museum will remain closed today (yesterday) for exceptional reasons. We apologize for the inconvenience", read a message published on the museum's official website. A group of four men stole jewelry on Sunday morning, in just a few minutes and when the museum was already open and with visitors inside, using a forklift machine, parked on the respective bank of the River Seine, and raising it to the height of a window on the first floor of the building. The group took eight pieces “of inestimable heritage value”, including the tiara of Empress Eugenie (wife of Napoleon III, emperor from 1852 to 1870) and two necklaces, the French Ministry of Culture reported on Sunday. That jewel alone has 212 pearls and 1,998 diamonds, according to the Louvre's description, while the pieces belonging to Queen Maria Amélia have multiple sapphires and hundreds of diamonds. This Parisian museum is the largest and most visited in the world, with nine million people enjoying part of the 35,000 works that the institution houses, in its 73 thousand square meters of space.

item.title: Study | Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the USA in 2024
item.description: North American President Donald Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the United States of America (USA) in 2024, concluded a study by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ). “US President Donald Trump was the dominant source and distributor of disinformation” in 2024, say the authors of the study “Disarming Disinformation: United States”. The study highlights that Trump has drawn on the functions of domestic political forces, rather than foreign state actors, as the main source of disinformation narratives in US political discourse. Furthermore, the existence of WhatsApp groups and other closed digital spaces often act as “information cocoons” that encourage rumors and other forms of misinformation. In this way, "the viral spread of misinformation and the strategic attack on journalists have emerged as interconnected threats to democracy. In an era of increasing authoritarianism and democratic backsliding, falsehoods are often used as a weapon by state actors to influence public opinion, undermine journalism and intimidate journalists." The study authors state that these factors are increasingly the North American reality, with Donald Trump “promulgating manifestly false narratives” in recent years. “The American media faces a profound information crisis, at a time of repression of freedom of expression”, the study reads. In this sense, trust in the mainstream press continues to decline in a climate of increasing attacks on the media by the Trump Government. The study published by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) was based on the analysis of 10,000 news and media publications during 2024, as well as a survey of 1,020 Americans.

item.title: Scientists ‘reduce’ the age of the Egyptian temple of Karnak, in Egypt
item.description: Researchers have carried out the most comprehensive geoarchaeological study of the Karnak temple, near Luxor, and revealed suggestive links to ancient Egyptian mythology and new data about the interaction between the complex's riverine landscape and the people who occupied the site during its almost 3,000 years of use. The results of the investigation were published on Monday in Antiquity magazine, reported the Efe news agency. Researchers from the University of Southampton, in the United Kingdom, and Uppsala University, in Sweden, participated in the study. Up to 61 sediment samples from the interior and surroundings of the temple and thousands of ceramic fragments found in the Karnak complex, located 500 meters east of the current Nile River, near Luxor, in the ancient Egyptian religious capital of Thebes, were analyzed. The researchers mapped how the landscape around the site changed throughout its history and found that, before 2520 BC, the site could not have been suitable for permanent occupation due to periodic flooding caused by the Nile's strong currents. Therefore, they placed the earliest occupation at Karnak during the Old Kingdom (between 2591 and 2152 BC). Pottery fragments found at the site corroborate this discovery, with the oldest dating between 2305 and 1980 BC. Therefore, the conclusions of this international team of researchers provide new evidence about the age of Karnak, which has been hotly debated in archaeological circles for decades. The origin of everything The ground on which the temple was founded was formed when river channels advanced west and east, creating an island of high ground in what is now the east-southeast region of the site. This emerging island laid the foundation for the occupation and initial construction of Karnak. Over the following centuries and millennia, the river channels on both sides of the site diverged further, creating more space for the development of the temple complex, as researchers have now confirmed. This new understanding of the temple's landscape bears striking similarities to an ancient Egyptian creation myth, leading the team to believe that the decision to locate the temple there may have been related to the religious views of its inhabitants. Ancient Egyptian texts from the Old Kingdom indicate that the 'Creator God' manifested himself as high ground emerging from the lake, and researchers have found that the island where Karnak was founded is the only known area of ​​high ground surrounded by water in the region. Thus, archaeologists have suggested that the Theban elites chose the location of Karnak to be the abode of a new form of 'Creator God', alluding to Amun-Ra, the supreme god of ancient Egypt, since the location fit perfectly into the mythological setting of the highlands that emerged from the surrounding waters as the origin of the formation of the Universe.

item.title: Physics | Nobel Prize for Macroscopic Quantum Mechanical Tunneling
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis “for the discovery of macroscopic quantum mechanical tunneling and the quantization of energy in an electrical circuit”, announced yesterday the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. "An important question in physics is the maximum size of a system capable of demonstrating the effects of quantum mechanics. This year's Nobel Prize laureates carried out experiments with an electrical circuit in which they demonstrated both quantum tunneling and quantized energy levels in a system large enough to be held in the hand", explains the Swedish Academy of Sciences in a statement published on its website. The British John Clarke carried out his research at the University of California, Berkeley, USA; the American John Martinis at the University of California, Santa Barbara; and the Frenchman Michel Devoret at Yale University and also in California, Santa Barbara. According to academia, quantum mechanics allows a particle to directly cross a barrier, through a process called tunneling. When a large number of particles are involved, quantum effects usually become negligible. The experiments of the now distinguished scientists demonstrated that quantum properties can be made concrete on a macroscopic scale. "It is wonderful to be able to celebrate the way in which quantum mechanics, more than a century old, continues to offer new surprises. It is also extremely useful, as it is the basis of all digital technology", said the president of the Nobel Committee for Physics, Olle Eriksson, quoted in the statement. The Swedish academy says that transistors in computer microchips are an example of consolidated quantum technology. The scientists today awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics share a prize of 11 million Swedish kronor (almost one million euros).

item.title: MIF / Portugal | Difficulties in selling agricultural products to China
item.description: João Moura, Secretary of State for Agriculture of Portugal, speaks of “many” difficulties when Portugal sells agricultural products in China. Conversely, he recognizes that there is a lot of interest from Chinese businesspeople in investing in the Portuguese agricultural sector The Secretary of State for Agriculture indicated yesterday, in Macau, that Portugal has excellent products and a “very significant interest” in the Chinese market, although it faces adversities that limit entry into the Asian country. “The difficulties are many, many times, in terms of diplomatic relations, exports, imports – some adjustments that need to be made”, admitted to journalists João Moura, who is in Macau representing the Government at the 30th Macau International Fair (MIF) and the 2nd China–Portuguese Speaking Countries Economic and Commercial Exhibition (C-PLPEX), which are taking place simultaneously. In parallel, the China-Portuguese Speaking Countries International Agricultural Expo is organized for the first time. These events, the person responsible highlighted, are “a great window of opportunity” to smooth out “some rough edges”. “We are in an interpretation that is often differentiated between markets as different as Portugal and China, in which food analysis and control have their differences, have their valences and, therefore, there is nothing better than talking, sitting at the table to try to overcome some of these difficulties and adversities”, he added. Portugal, said the Secretary of State, has “several ideas” and “several products with great potential”, namely dried fruits, pork, olive oil and wine. “We have a lot of opportunity for Portuguese products that are widely accepted in China,” he said. “We have products with great export capacity, with great worldwide acceptance and, therefore, the Chinese market is a market that is of very significant interest to us, he stated. Sinic interest In the opposite direction, he declared that he felt in Macau “a great interest from China” in Portugal, not only in terms of exports, but also with regard to the “internationalization of some Chinese companies”. Companies in the field of technology, machinery or equipment in the area of ​​agriculture, said João Moura, without providing additional details about these companies. “They are very interested in the development of some sectors of our agriculture and we are open to welcome them”, he concluded. In a speech given during the Round Table of Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises in China and Portuguese-Speaking Countries, the Portuguese representative highlighted the “crucial role” of Macau as a connection platform, noting that the geographical and cultural position of the territory makes it “a point of convergence between East and West”, facilitating trade and investment. "In turn, Portugal has, in the global context, a strategic position that connects the Eastern world and the American continent, without forgetting the African continent. These more agile and integrative platforms encourage and provide commercial exchanges and the growth of new companies", he said.

item.title: Lam Lon Wai calls for more support after warning from TUI president
item.description: Deputy Lam Lon Wai considered that support for families should be reinforced so that they can deal with behavioral and deviant problems among young people. The deputy reacted thus to the newspaper Ou Mun, after the speech by Song Man Lei, president of the Court of Final Instance (TUI), presented this Tuesday at the opening of the 2025/2026 judicial year. Lam Lon Wai, recently re-elected and linked to the Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau (FAOM), highlighted that the increase in crime associated with minors involves several factors, such as social changes or technological development, making it increasingly easier for young people to have access to information that could cause complications or lead to deviant behavior. The deputy director of the Secondary School for Sons and Brothers of Workers also spoke about the fact that the family has little capacity to supervise the behavior of young people, while schools have a lack of legal education and there is no wide range of measures in the area of ​​mental health. Lam Lon Wai believes that there must be reinforcement in all these areas, suggesting a reform of the educational guardianship regime for young offenders, in order to respond to the current situation. Collective effort In his speech this Tuesday, Song Man Lei recalled that “for the second consecutive year there was an increase in the number of civil cases filed in the Civil Courts of the Base Judicial Court (TJB)”, with “the problems of deviant behavior of minors and offenses being increasingly serious”. “In the last judicial year, cases relating to the general social protection regime and the educational guardianship regime, filed with the TJB's Family and Minors Court, increased from 45 and 54 to 72 and 85, respectively, registering increases of 60 and 57 percent”, he recalled. Song Man Lei described that these data “highlight the upward trend of situations in which minors are at risk or in unfavorable environments for their growth and the situation of juvenile delinquency”. These are processes “intimately related to the family environment, and the simultaneous increase in numbers demonstrates that some families present dysfunctions in terms of education, communication and emotional support”, where “parents are unable to effectively exercise their parental responsibilities because they are busy with work, because they do not have knowledge in the area of ​​education or because they face emotional and economic pressures”.

item.title: Social Workers | Paul Pun remains as leader of the board
item.description: Paul Pun Chi Meng will remain president of the Professional Council of Social Workers for the next three years, according to information published yesterday in the Official Bulletin. This is a position that is currently held by the general secretary of Cáritas Macau. The Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, O Lam, also chose to renew the mandates of Alice Wong, head of the Legal and Translation Division of the Institute of Social Action, Lok Chan Nei, representative of the City University of Macau and social workers Sou Keng Ieong and Ieong Sok Chong. The new appointments also include the Professional Council of Social Workers Chan Keng Fan, from the Macau Polytechnic University, Francisco Botelho, from the University of São José, Im Ka Wai, from the Association of Social Workers of Macau, and social workers Choi Wan Hon and Chao Kam Kin. The Professional Council of Social Workers controls access to the profession by preparing, approving and publishing the criteria for professional accreditation, approving new requests for professional accreditation, in addition to coordinating access to the profession as well as the certification of professional accreditation.

item.title: CPPCC | Visit to Portugal with request from overseas Chinese
item.description: A visit to Portugal by the Liaison Committee with Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan and Overseas Chinese of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference began on October 14th. In a colloquium, Liu Cigui, director of the Committee, defended greater work by Chinese people living outside the country in defense of the country's unification The Liaison Committee with Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan and Overseas Chinese of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) is in Portugal on an official visit, which began on October 14th. According to the newspaper Ou Mun, Liu Cigui, director of the aforementioned Committee, defended, in a colloquium, that the Chinese residing in Portugal must firmly defend the unification of the country, opposing all ideas of independence. Liu Cigui, also head of the delegation, participated in the colloquium together with representatives of Portuguese companies with Chinese capital invested, the Luso-Chinese Association of Traders and Industrialists and overseas Chinese. The official also said at the colloquium that unity and an expanded connection with Chinese people living abroad are essential work of the CPPCC Committee, with the expectation that these Chinese people will come together to build a harmonious community outside the country, promoting the growth of new generations of Chinese. Cultural bridge The director also hoped that overseas Chinese would use culture as a bridge to connect them to the country, promoting positive voices from China. Liu Cigui recalled that this year marks the 20th anniversary of the establishment, between China and Portugal, of a comprehensive strategic partnership, and over this time both countries have strengthened mutual political trust. For Liu Cigui, there are fruitful results from this cooperation in several areas. Regarding the future of the bilateral relationship, the official said he hopes that China and Portugal will continue to maintain traditional ties of friendship and can reinforce the alignment of development strategies, expanding cooperation in areas such as innovation, green economy, oceans and medicine, among others. Liu Cigui also spoke about Macau's role in this relationship. According to Ou Mun, it considered that the Macao SAR could have a unique role as a connecting bridge between the two countries, and should make good use of the Forum Macau mechanism and encourage cultural, educational, tourist and scientific research exchanges. Liu Cigui also left the hope that companies with Chinese capital in Portugal and the Chinese community take advantage of the advantages they have and make a stronger contribution to cooperation and friendship between the two countries. As part of this visit to Portugal, the delegation also traveled to Quinta da Marmeleira, located in Alenquer, a wine production project with investment from the now deceased Macau businessman, Wu Zhiwei. Liu Cigui praised the project and recalled that, in recent years, it has played a role as a bridge between Macau, China and Portugal, actively participating in projects in the Greater Bay Area and the development of Hengqin. For the person responsible, this is a good example of a Macau company that is integrated into national development and reaches abroad through the Macao SAR.

item.title: AAM | Limited publication of rulings is not very transparent
item.description: At the opening of another Judicial Year, Vong Hin Fai, president of the Macau Lawyers Association, lamented that there is a “partial and limited publication” of court rulings, which poses problems regarding “judicial transparency”. As for law, the outlook is one of stability The president of the Macau Lawyers Association (AAM), Vong Hin Fai, warned about the limited publication of some court rulings, which, in his opinion, raises questions of lack of transparency. This idea was left in the speech given at another opening of the Judicial Year. In his opinion, there is “a partial publication limited to a few instances, far from public expectations regarding judicial transparency”. The person responsible gives the example of “the decisions of the Base Judicial Court, namely those decisions of the first instance that cannot be appealed, which are not published in a systematic and regular manner, which could lead to a lack of uniformity in legal opinions in different cases”. This also results in “limitations to legal research and education due to a lack of sufficient practical material”. Publishing more rulings would increase “the transparency of final judicial decisions” and allow “greater disclosure of judicial justice”, in addition to allowing “the public to better understand the legal consequences for each type of act”. “Stable development” With regard to law, Sam Hou Fai mentioned numbers that show a sign of stability: currently, the AAM has increased the number of registered lawyers sixfold compared to “the 74 lawyers registered in 1991”. There is, therefore, “stable development”, with 449 registered lawyers, which, even so, “represents a decrease of 15 registered lawyers, around 3.2 percent, compared to the 464 registered lawyers in the same period of the previous year”. There are also 142 trainee lawyers. In his speech, Vong Hin Fai did not fail to highlight that “AAM faces some challenges”, taking into account the “continuous development of our work”, namely the lack of space. “The Association's current space is very limited and insufficient for the installation of arbitration court rooms, mediation rooms, related equipment and facilities, which makes it difficult to fulfill its assigned functions”. The director also highlighted the existence of 602 more cases pending in relation to the previous Judicial Year (2024/2025), an increase of 4.9 percent, taking into account that last year there were 12,379 cases pending. “This demonstrates that the number of legal cases continues to grow and that the burden on the judicial system continues to increase”, he warned.

item.title: Judicial Year | EC highlights “solid progress in defending material justice”
item.description: Sam Hou Fai, Chief Executive, spoke yesterday, for the first time, at the opening ceremony of another judicial year as the Macao SAR's highest ruler. The former president of the Court of Final Instance (TUI) highlighted that, “over the last year, Macau's judicial bodies have made solid progress in defending material justice, increasing judicial efficiency and improving the judicial system”. Sam Hou Fai also recalled that “in the judicial history of Macau there have never been so many magistrates and bailiffs and so much importance has never been given” to the infrastructure “of judicial bodies by the Government”. The Chief Executive explained that “the judiciary must accurately understand the essence of the principle of ‘one country, two systems'”, and that, “through judicial practices, it must decisively defend national sovereignty, security and development interests”, as well as “firmly support and cooperate with the Macao SAR Government in governing in accordance with the law”.

item.title: MP | Tong Hio Fong believes in recovering the organization's reputation
item.description: Tong Hio Fong, Macao SAR Prosecutor, said yesterday, at the solemn opening session of the judicial year, that he believes that the reputation of this judicial body will be restored. The “revelation and punishment of corruption cases in the past” caused a “very negative impact on the reputation of the Public Prosecutor's Office”, admitted Tong Hio Fong, in a speech at the opening session of the judicial year. Recognizing the “commitment and dedication of the entire team in the face of the illicit and immoral acts carried out by some in the past”, Tong Hio Fong said he was convinced that, “with persistent and concerted effort” by MP employees, “the public trust placed in the institution will be restored”. Tong Hio Fong also highlighted in his speech the “increase in the number of investigations into sexual crimes against minors”. In his speech, the Public Prosecutor (MP) stated that 61 investigations of sexual crimes against minors were booked last year, “which represents an increase of 27.08 percent when compared to the previous judicial year”. In general terms, and with regard to crimes against sexual freedom and self-determination, “in the last judicial year, a total of 235 investigations were prosecuted, representing a slight increase of 2.17 percent compared to the 230 investigations prosecuted in the previous judicial year”. 30 investigations relating to the crime of rape were registered, “which represents a decrease of 47.37 percent compared to the previous judicial year”, but Tong Hio Fong also highlighted that, of the 61 investigations assessed in the area of ​​sexual crimes against minors, 26 investigations concern the sexual abuse of children. The Prosecutor also highlighted the “significant increase in gambling-related crimes”, especially with regard to crimes related to illicit gambling, with 760 investigations filed in the 2024/2025 judicial year, an increase of 435 cases, 133.85 percent more, compared to the previous year. This is due to the entry into force of the Law to combat illegal gambling crimes, he explained. Tong Hio Fong also spoke of the change from a “continuous downward trend to a gradual increase in drug-related investigations”.

item.title: Global Strategic Triangle (I)
item.description: “The divergence between American and European strategic analysis is more instrumental than sincere.” José Milhazes The war in Ukraine is not just a regional tragedy. It is the reflection of a systemic transition that crosses the world, where the balance between powers, alliances and civilizations is being reconfigured. The conflict, although localized, contains three interconnected dimensions that make it one of the most significant events of the post-Cold War era. The first dimension, visceral and immediate, is the bloodiest. It is a confrontation between what remains of the Russian empire, driven by a drive for historical greatness, and the Ukrainian nation, which seeks to assert itself as a sovereign and independent state, free from Moscow influence. This struggle, which mixes elements of civil war with post-Soviet succession disputes, is marked by imperial memories, historical resentments and national ambitions. Ukraine, in trying to consolidate its political and cultural identity, directly challenges the Russian narrative of Slavic unity and imperial continuity. The second dimension, more structural and continental in scope, involves the Euro-Atlantic space in a process of transformation. Since the collapse of the Soviet Union, the expansion of Western influence eastward has been constant. The integration of the former East Germany, the accession of the Baltic countries, Poland, Romania and, more recently, Finland and Sweden to NATO, outline a path towards approaching the Russian border. Moscow's military offensive against Kiev appears as a reaction to this eastern march, trying to prevent Ukraine from becoming an advanced platform for American influence. From this perspective, Ukrainian fighters become pieces on a larger board, where Washington projects power through alliances and indirect support. The rhetoric of the “collective West”, although used as an instrument of internal mobilization by Russia, proves to be useful in giving the intervention the status of a patriotic war. The third dimension, quieter but decisive, is part of the systemic challenge between global powers. Ukraine has become a testing ground for the resilience of alliances, the effectiveness of containment strategies, and the ability of great powers to adapt. The conflict draws a geometry of pairs with Ukraine and the United States on one side; Russia and its strategic partners on the other. China, although not directly involved, observes with attention and prudence, calibrating its movements on a board where regional stability and strategic autonomy are priorities. Its stance, marked by moderation and pragmatism, helps to avoid an uncontrolled escalation and preserves channels of dialogue that could be crucial for an eventual resolution. In this scenario, the war in Ukraine contains the ingredients for a global escalation, if one of the vertices of the geopolitical triangle Washington, Moscow or Beijing decides to break the tacit balance. The only sustainable solution seems to lie in an understanding between these three powers, capable of preventing Kiev from becoming the stage for a new global war, similar to those that marked the last century. Europe, for its part, is watching the tragedy unfold with increasing apathy. Its eastern border burns, but the European public, tired and divided, hesitates between involvement and distancing. Ukraine, technically bankrupt and dependent on foreign aid, sees half of its population living in the diaspora. Those who remain face a war of survival, aware that total victory is unlikely. The tacit aim appears to be to weaken Russia, even if this means eroding European stability. NATO's northeastern front, centered in Poland and extending from the Arctic to the Black Sea, emerges as a possible flashpoint. Germany, with its historical memory and geopolitical responsibility, will be decisive in the reconstruction of post-conflict Ukraine. Its influence, discreet but profound, contrasts with Polish assertiveness, marked by regional rivalries. On the horizon, a Korean-style ceasefire scenario can be seen, with a new steel curtain dividing the country. The reconstruction will be shared among the Western allies, with demarcated fiefdoms and crossed interests. Russia, in turn, will be able to consolidate a New Russia, extending from Transnistria to the Baltic, paying homage to the tsars who projected the empire towards Europe. The logic of military capabilities, more than declared intentions, fuels the possibility of preventive confrontations. Tactical nuclear escalation, although unwanted, becomes an almost automatic consequence in an environment of mutual distrust. The cautious United States prefers to shift its focus to the Indo-Pacific, while the Europeans, torn between ambitions and resentment, face the dilemma of rearming without the American nuclear umbrella. The strategic divergence between Americans and Europeans is more functional than ideological. In Washington, the partial withdrawal from Europe is seen as an opportunity to redistribute resources and test the autonomy of allies. In Europe, this withdrawal is interpreted as an opportunity to reconfigure ambitions and settle historical accounts. (Continues)

item.title: Contributing a vivid example of China's governance to the advancement of the global cause of women
item.description: By Liu Xianfa Commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the Macau Special Administrative Region The Global Leaders' Meeting on Women, with the theme “A Shared Future: New and Accelerated Process for the Integral Development of Women”, took place in Beijing, from 13 to 14 October, in commemoration of the 30th anniversary of the IV World Conference on Women and with a view to discussing the development of the global cause of women. President Xi Jinping attended the opening ceremony of the Meeting and delivered the keynote speech entitled “Carrying Forward the Spirit of the Beijing World Conference on Women and Promoting the New and Accelerated Process for Women's All-Round Development”, in which he comprehensively and systematically demonstrated the achievements of Chinese modernization and the cause of women in New Era China, presented China's proposals for accelerating the new process of women's all-round development in light of global trends and announced China's solutions to further support the development of women's global cause. With successful practices and fruitful achievements, China has contributed to the whole world yet another vivid example of “Chinese governance”. In China, the cause of women has always constituted an important part of the Chinese modernization process. Since its founding in 1921, the Communist Party of China has been committed to women's liberation and gender equality. After the establishment of the People's Republic of China, a series of laws and regulations were enacted that protected women's rights and interests, achieving historic improvements in women's status in terms of education, employment, political participation and marital autonomy. Entering the new era, the CPC Central Committee, with Comrade Xi Jinping as the core, has emphasized safeguarding women's legitimate rights and interests, promoting gender equality and women's all-round development as integral components of Chinese modernization. A series of pioneering, general and long-term decisions and plans have been made, and the cause of China's women has made historic achievements and changes. We won the greatest battle against poverty in human history and thus brought moderate prosperity to 690 million women. We have reduced the maternal mortality rate by nearly 80% since 1995 and have joined leading upper-middle-income countries in key maternal and child health indicators. Currently, women represent more than 40% of China's total workforce and more than half of the country's internet startup entrepreneurs. In the new era, Chinese women, more confident and vibrant, participate in the entire governance process of the country and society. The cause of women in China has enjoyed wider development spaces and more promising prospects than ever before. After his return to his homeland, Macau experienced a golden age in the development of women's causes. The educational level, labor market participation, industrial coverage, professional level and income of women in Macau have improved significantly. With great courage and enthusiasm, Women have made significant contributions in all spheres of life, supporting half the sky for the development of Macau. Since 2008, the Macau General Women's Association obtained special consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council, thus being officially qualified by the United Nations to assist in international affairs and, since then, it has participated in the sessions of the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW) for 15 consecutive years. Macau has already become an indispensable force in telling the stories of China and Macau's successful practice of “one country, two systems” among the international community. China has given firm support and active contribution to the development of the global cause of women. As President Xi Jinping has highlighted, women play an important role in the creation, promotion and development of human civilization, and the international community has a shared responsibility to advance the cause of women. China upholds the vision of building a community with a shared future for humanity and has transformed the Global Development Initiative, the Global Security Initiative, the Global Civilization Initiative and the Global Governance Initiative into concrete actions to promote the all-round development of women, so as to actively provide opportunities and support for the global cause of women through their development. China actively participates in global governance in the field of women, supports the United Nations in prioritizing women's work, creates the Prize for the Education of Girls and Women in partnership with UNESCO and has announced three donations of 10 million dollars to UN Women. In the face of global challenges, China has sent more than 1,200 female officers and military personnel to participate in UN peacekeeping operations, providing humanitarian assistance to women and children affected by conflicts and disasters. China has been deepening global exchanges and cooperation between women, maintaining friendly relations with women's organizations and institutions in more than 140 countries, implementing projects worth more than 40 million dollars in the women's sector in more than 20 countries, cultivating more than 200,000 female talents in more than 180 countries and regions, and providing assistance for women's employment in more than 100 countries. The development of women's cause in China has provided a referenceable Chinese solution to the global women's cause, which is widely recognized and praised by the international community. Renewing our dedication to the purpose of the Beijing World Conference on Women and joining forces to create a better future for the advancement of the global cause of women. Globally, gender-based violence, digital inequality and the shadow of war and conflict still persist. Looking to the future, we must renew ourselves in favor of the purpose of the Beijing World Conference on Women to build greater consensus, expand the paths forward and take more concrete measures, with the aim of accelerating the new process of women's integral development. President Xi Jinping, at the height of the progress of human civilization and the peaceful development of the world, with a global vision and sense of responsibility as the leader of a great country, proposed four suggestions for the global cause of women, which are: “jointly promote an environment conducive to the growth and development of women”, “jointly cultivate a vigorous drive for high-quality development of the cause of women”, “jointly build governance structures to protect the rights and interests of women” and “together write a new chapter in promoting global cooperation for women”. A series of new measures taken by China to support the development of the global women's cause were also announced. China is willing to work with all countries in the world to overcome global challenges with action-oriented vision, accelerate the new process of women's comprehensive development with unity, confidence, courage and practice, push forward the construction of a fairer and more reasonable global governance system, and join forces to move towards a community with a shared future for humanity. With a shared destiny and hand in hand, women will move towards a promising future. As an active and firm supporter of global cooperation in the cause of women, China will continue to work with all countries to take accelerated actions to write a new chapter in the process of women's integral development!

item.title: Musk's billion-dollar plan (1)
item.description: A director's duty is to work to optimize the performance of his company and maximize its profits. When the company increases earnings, it is natural that the director is financially rewarded. However, the media recently released a report from the most influential consulting firm in the world, Institutional Shareholder Services, which spoke out against the award to Elon Musk, Tesla's Executive Director, of 1 billion dollars as a reward for his performance, as this amount was too high. This recommendation could prevent Musk, “a lover of challenges”, from obtaining compensation for the feat of “landing on Mars”. The plan to award Musk a billion dollars in compensation emerged last September, when Tesla's Board of Directors asked him to increase the company's productivity over the next ten years. If successful, he would receive that amount in shares. The plan is divided into 12 steps. After completing each of them, you receive 1% of the shares. Once they are all completed, you will receive 12%, an amount estimated to be no less than 1 billion dollars. The main points are: Sale of 20 million electric vehicles 10 million subscriptions to the autonomous car system One million autonomous cars registered and in operation. From September 3, 2025, the delivery of a cumulative total of one million Optimus humanoid robots. The company's capitalization will increase in 12 phases, from the current approximately 1.1 billion to 8.5 billion, eight times more. The company's profit, after deducting interest, taxes and depreciation, will reach 400 billion. The financial compensation plan presented in 2025 is not new. In 2018, Tesla approved a $56 billion plan. It also had a 10-year scope, over which Musk's performance would be evaluated and, if he reached the objectives defined by Tesla, he would receive shares worth 56 billion dollars. In January 2024, the Delaware Court of Chancery rejected the plan due to the lack of independence of the board of directors and the excessive amount of compensation. Although 90% of shareholders agreed to a second vote, the court again rejected the resolution due to procedural errors. This month, Tesla filed an appeal with the Delaware Supreme Court, requesting approval of the $1 billion compensation plan. This plan links Tesla's business to Musk's performance, highlighting that Tesla is not just a car manufacturer, but that it aspires to broadly develop the business at the level of artificial intelligence and robotics. Of course, this path involves significant changes. First, Tesla's sales in markets such as France, Sweden, Denmark and California are currently declining, and profits from its core business are falling. From a more prudent point of view, should Tesla first revitalize its traditional business before moving on to new adventures? If the revitalization of car sales is successful, then the development of other business areas would be cause for celebration. However, if it fails, should Tesla abandon the automotive sector and focus on new businesses? These risks and these bets are issues that Tesla, its board of directors and its shareholders must confront and consider. Secondly, Tesla plans to make autonomous cars. This will not only increase the value of these vehicles but will also pave the way for autonomous cars to enter the market. If the research is successful, Tesla will transform from a simple car manufacturer to a car manufacturer and autonomous vehicle service provider. Let's imagine that the autonomous vehicle business could be charged monthly, similar to what cell phone operators do, then this company's profits would undoubtedly be much greater than those obtained from simply selling cars. While providing autonomous driving services generates stable, long-lasting profits, the technology that supports them is not yet mature. If an autonomous car is involved in an accident, it will be harmful to the car owner, other drivers and the Government. Furthermore, the implementation of autonomous driving will inevitably require a review of road legislation. It is also unknown whether third-party accident insurance coverage will need to be modified. Changes in the global market will generate significant uncertainty for Tesla's autonomous vehicle business. Next week, we will continue to discuss the impact of $1 trillion worth of equity compensation on the business world. item.title: Populism has fallen into the well
item.description: André Ventura had announced that in the local elections he would win the presidency of around 30 councils. In 308, he obtained the “resounding” result of three Municipal Chambers. The polls that we unfortunately still have showed that victory would belong to AD, second place to Chega and third to the Socialist Party. Television commentators were full of praising the polls and pointing out that Chega's result would be normal because the PS had been in absolute decline since the last legislative elections. They were wrong, once again. Polls and commentators. The Socialist Party rose from the ashes and achieved a very positive result. Overall, they did not lose by much and in terms of results from parties alone, without coalitions, the socialists obtained almost twice as many Municipal Chambers as the PSD. It has been proven that without radical populism, without xenophobia, without racism and without the cries of André Ventura, Chega is a flop at a local level, especially in the interior of the country. Populism has fallen into the well and we will see when the “firefighters” can bring it to the surface. Chega won in Entroncamento without knowing exactly why, it won in a Madeiran town where half a dozen people live and it won in Albufeira because the owners of the bars and hotels managed to convince the entire clientele and neighborhood to vote for the neo-Nazis. The voters of Albufeira will cry drool and snot because Chega recommends in its Algarve program that bars close at two in the morning and the owners of these nightlife establishments demand that they close at four in the morning. Local discontent will prevail and will certainly translate into the next elections. This, in Albufeira, because in the rest of the Algarve Chega thought of winning everything. Not even that kind of tavern keeper who is always shouting in Parliament and wiping sweat from his bald head managed to win in Faro. The global map is divided between the AD/IL and the pink party. Cavakistan ended after several decades. You saw that there was always that Ruas, who dyes his hair and mustache wanting to look like he was 30 years old, he had a defeat like he never expected. In Lisbon and Porto, the case has already caused a lot of talk. The victories of AD and its Liberal Initiative counterparts in Lisbon, and in Porto with the verbal support of Rui Moreira, the mayor who ended his controversial mandates, were obtained by a minimal margin and until midnight on election Sunday the television stations were only talking about a technical draw. It was sad to see Luís Montenegro, in his capacity as prime minister versus president of the PSD, on election day calling for votes for his fellow candidates, going absolutely against the law. Montenegro claimed victory, but it could have been a little more humble because the municipal victory was tangential and lost many important Chambers such as Braga and Coimbra. The people, this time, showed great civic sense and abstention was one of the lowest in electoral history. At many polling stations the queues were huge and the wait was very long. It was the translation that abstention would download. Even so, the fraud did not cease to exist. In one region of the country, the old illegality of a party having had voting slips printed similar to those given to voters and then proposing that their appeased parties carry a ballot in their pocket with a cross in the party in question and when they brought the blank ballot that the polling station had delivered, they would receive two thousand euros. Not bad for a few thousand “mercenaries”. The people are fed up with elections, but nothing about the matter is going to end. The spearheads of the candidates for President of the Republic are already on the road. The variety is huge, but almost all in the same direction. On the center right we have Admiral Gouveia e Melo with Marques Mendes. Even further to the right appears the “bocas” André Ventura and Cotrim Figueiredo, who was leader of the Liberal Initiative. On the moderate left side, António José Seguro appeared and it was only last Saturday that the Socialist Party decided to officially support the candidate António José Seguro. Too late. And even so, the leftmost socialist wing will vote for António Filipe of the PCP, in the good style of Álvaro Cunhal, who suggested that sometimes you have to cover your eyes to vote for someone who doesn't belong to the party. This time, the polls seem to be getting it right. A polling company, in which we have the greatest confidence, obtained in a national survey carried out last week, that there will be a second round between Gouveia e Melo and António José Seguro. However, when the respondents were faced with the final decision in the second round, victory fell to the admiral. Because, just as we wrote last Monday, Luís Montenegro, with this municipal victory, will not resign, even if the Public Ministry opens a judicial inquiry against the current prime minister regarding the case of his family company Spinumviva. The man has been in politics for many years and knows everything about how to defend himself against suspicions of alleged scammers. Portugal will continue to be governed by a politician under serious suspicion, but that in no way affects his unhealthy desire to be head of the Executive.

item.title: Picture books | Exhibition opens to the public Friday
item.description: The “Exhibition of Illustrated Books in Chinese and Portuguese” opens to the public this Friday, which will be on view at the Carmo Auditorium until the 2nd of November, as part of the seventh edition of the “Encounter in Macau – Festival of Arts and Culture between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries”, which also includes the Lusofonia Festival. According to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC), which promotes the exhibition, the exhibition's theme is “World of Fairy Tales”, displaying “a diverse selection of illustrated books and children's and youth literature from publishers in Mainland China, Macau, Portugal and Angola, with more than 800 books available for purchase”. In addition, there will be several parallel activities, including book presentation sessions, workshops, puppet shows and face painting. All activities are open to the general public. According to the IC, “the event aims to make publications from China and Portuguese-speaking countries better known to the public, as well as promoting cultural exchange between China and Portuguese-speaking countries”. Ten puppet theater sessions will also be held in surrounding locations, in order to spread the reading atmosphere throughout the historic area through animated and lively shows and a selection of illustrated books. The exhibition takes place between 10am and 10pm. Registration for activities can be made through the Macau Single Account platform.

item.title: D’As Entranhas | “Common Vision” by Pedro Pascoinho to see on display
item.description: This Saturday, D’As Entranhas Macau – Associação Cultural presents a new exhibition to the public at the Lotus Art Space gallery. This is the work of Portuguese artist Pedro Pascoinho, included in the “Common Vision” exhibition. There are 20 charcoal drawings made on “artistic fabrianno” paper, which reveal very unique compositions and visions. It all started in the beauty of the Lou Lim Ieoc garden, an iconic place in Macau that Pedro Pascoinho, a Portuguese artist, visited for the first time in 2019. This was also the first time that the artist set foot in the territory and now he does so again with the exhibition “Common Vision”, organized by D’Entranhas – Associação Cultural and curated by Vera Paz. “Common Vision” therefore began to be imagined in the Chinese-inspired garden, but it aims to show a certain common vision of how apparently different things can have points in common. "I really like Chinese painting, although Chinese painting is quite vast, but I especially like ancient painting from the 13th and 14th centuries. It was there [during the visit to Lou Lim Ieoc] that I thought about establishing some parallel", he told HM. And according to a note from As Entranhas, what will be presented from this Saturday, at 6:30 pm, at the Lotus Art Space gallery, are 20 charcoal works on “fabrianno artistic” paper, consisting of “drawings of variable dimensions, in which Pascoinho shows us intimate, sober and refined compositions, which he himself considers universal”. There is in “Common Vision” an “intentional choice of elements in the narrative construction”, as is the case of “fragments, objects, figures and represented landscapes that evoke enigmatic, almost ghostly spaces that take us back to the passage of time”. These drawings are designed individually, but “are born from the desire to create a space of common memory”, in an “attempt to find new paths and references, in any time or place”. This is an “essential condition” of the artist’s work: an “inner observation and critical thinking”, mirrored in this exhibition. In an interview with HM, the artist highlighted that this exhibition “brings a somewhat common vision, in the sense that our Western aesthetic is different from the Eastern one, but there is still a proximity”. Always the drawing Pedro Pascoinho's vision always translates into the desire to make drawings, not photographs. "What I do is start from fragments with an almost photographic base, although my intention is not to produce photography, but rather drawings. Basically, it is as if these works had a code, but a code that is quite universal, in which we can understand the image well, in a certain way. Hence this logic of 'common vision', of a common vision about things." Pedro Pascoinho talks about how “the images and fragments were common, with a somewhat universal approach”, in which “you manage to capture the object, which ends up being figurative”. "There is not a way of seeing here, but rather of observing. Things are in front of us, but then the observation depends on each one. There are several messages and readings that can be made. It is a figurative work, but it doesn't just go in one direction and I like to have things open like that, because then it depends on each one how to observe things." Regarding his passion for Chinese painting, Pedro Pascoinho speaks of a “very advanced painting for the time”, being “aesthetically different” from Portuguese painting of those years, and even European painting. “Despite this, you can learn a lot, even through the themes themselves, both in terms of the landscape and the contemplative side of the pieces.” In 2019, Pedro Pascoinho took “Establishment” to Macau, namely to Casa Garden. Since then, “significant changes” have taken place in his work. That year there were changes in the “very composition” of the works and in the choice of colors, or lack thereof. "I think about the work before executing it, and for me it is as if it were a painting without colors, a black and white drawing. And in this exhibition “Common Vision” there is only one work with color. There was then this change, since 2020, in which I have only dedicated myself to drawing on a large scale and in which there is an absence of color. I had a debate about white, because it is a color that I don't deal with very well, it isn't even a color at all." Pedro Pascoinho always approached color and “worked in series”, but at the end of 2019 it was already “difficult to think at the level of color, and then, even due to the way the world changed, from then on it became more difficult to think about colors”. "It's difficult to see things and produce in color, and I started to see the world in black and white. I'm not saying that I don't do things in color, but, for me, the preference and the way I think, the absence of color is part of that. It's difficult to think about color", he stressed. About Macau, he says he was surprised. “It’s having contact with a completely different culture, it seems that we are always looking for what is Portuguese”, analyzing a kind of relationship with a territory “that is different from China”. “There is always this interesting side, where I was able to see points that, for me, ended up being fascinating, from the markets to the food,” he said. The exhibition will be on view at the Lotus Art Space gallery until November 19th, from Tuesday to Sunday, from 1pm to 7pm.

item.title: Lusofonia Festival | Calema, from São Tomé, performs this Saturday
item.description: The Calema concert takes place this weekend in another edition of the Lusofonia Festival. The brother and sister duo will take the stage at Casas Museu da Taipa on Saturday, starting at 9:30 pm. There are, however, sounds from other countries in the Lusophony universe, such as Rui Orlando, from Angola performing on Sunday or Memu Sunhu, Carimbó Paidégua and Negros Unidos, a group from Equatorial Guinea They are the brothers António and Fradique Mendes Ferreira and together they make up Calema. Originally from São Tomé and Príncipe, and residing in Portugal, the two brothers are traveling to Macau this week to participate in another edition of the popular Lusofonia Festival. The lights and music are felt on the stage at Casas Museu da Taipa, this Saturday, from 9:30 pm, in a show with free entry. In Portugal, the Calema have been a success story. They started their career around 15 years ago and have performed on impressive stages such as Estádio da Luz and at dozens of music festivals. The first album was released in 2010, entitled “Ni Mondja Anguené”, followed by “Bomu Kêlê”, released in 2014, and “A Nossa Vez”, in 2017. This is followed by “Yellow Voyage”, released in 2020″, and “Voyage – Part II”, released four years later, and “Voyage – Part III”. In 2019, an album arrived that seems to be a kind of consecration, when the duo released “Ao Vivo no Campo Pequeno”, one of the most important concert halls in Lisbon. The single “Maria Joana”, recorded with singers Nuno Ribeiro and fado singer Mariza, released more recently, won the Play – Portuguese Music Awards in the Song of the Year category. But Calema have been immersed in solidarity projects, going beyond music. One of the examples is the fact that, in August this year, the duo received the designation of goodwill ambassadors of the Community of Portuguese Speaking Countries (CPLP) in the area of ​​culture and music, having stressed that they want to be an example for young people. "When we were starting out, we didn't have any example because everything seemed very difficult. (…) I think, in a certain way, you can show them [young people] that it is possible, that there is a process and that if you work, if you believe, your dream can come true, but it depends a lot on you. It's that light that we want", declared Fradique Mendes Ferreira to Lusa, upon receiving this appointment. António Mendes Ferreira stressed that the appointment of CPLP ambassadors is a source of pride. "We have always made music with the aim of making people happy, communicating with them, connecting with them, and being part of this family that is CPLP is incredible. We have grown within the community and its culture", said António. Other sounds The Lusofonia stage will be filled with other sounds in the Portuguese language, as is the case of Rui Orlando, who will perform on Sunday, 26th, from 8:40 pm. Originally from Angola, Rui is a musician, composer and instrumentalist, having won the television competition “Angola Encanta” in 2011. Rui Orlando has a degree in accounting and management, but his passion for music won. At the age of 20, he took an intensive course in Lisbon and there he began to dedicate himself to his artistic career. Memu Sunhu arrives from Guinea-Bissau, who will perform this Friday from 8:40 pm. This is a very recent group, formed in 2021 by four musicians: Ninanca Alfredo Carlos Banca, Desejado Carlos Gomes Sadjó, Sadibo Coté and Malam Djudju Mané. The collective is known for mixing different musical genres with the more traditional music of Guinea-Bissau. From Brazil, Carimbó Paidégua also arrives, who will perform on Sunday from 7:10 pm. This band is a collective researching music and dances linked to the Amazon rainforest and is based in the city of São Paulo. Also noteworthy is the performance of Negros Unidos, coming from Equatorial Guinea, with a performance scheduled for Saturday from 7:55 pm. The Lusofonia festival continues the following weekend with more musical performances, gastronomy and craft spaces. With Lusa

item.title: Albergue SCM hosts 11th Halloween party this weekend
item.description: Taking place this Saturday and Sunday, the 25th and 26th of October, the “11th Halloween Albergue SCM”, with various activities for children and adults, which promises to transport the public “to a world of pumpkins and captivating Halloween festivities”. According to a note from Albergue da Santa Casa da Misericórdia, this year's event has the theme “Ghost Party”, including the “Spider Tunnel” activity and a variety of “ghostly decorations”. Thus, at the beginning of the evening, there will be “free makeup stalls, clown performances and an exciting challenge in the ‘Haunted House of Cockroaches’ in the Albergue SCM square, suitable for participants of all ages”. In addition, between 3pm and 6pm, the activity “Albergue SCM – Let’s Trick or Treat” will be presented, an “exciting event that invites children aged 5 to 12, accompanied by an adult, to embark on an exciting adventure, in search of hidden treasures in the São Lázaro neighborhood”. Here, participants are equipped with a map and can explore “unique streets and alleys, collecting ‘mysterious patterns’ and being able to win delicious sweets on the return to Albergue SCM”. 11 years of celebration Another highlight is the holding, between Saturday and Tuesday, of the “Albergue SCM Halloween Costume Competition”, in which, in order to win prizes, participants have to take a photo of their costume inside the Hostel space, sharing and commenting on the image on social media. The comment with the most likes will receive a prize. For the event organizers, “Halloween is not only a festival that celebrates the autumn harvest, but also a platform for global cultural exchange”. For these activities, prior registration is required through Albergue SCM's official contacts or on social media. It was in 2013 that Albergue SCM, through CAC – Círculo de Amigos da Cultura, began celebrating Halloween, with the support of the Macau Cultural Institute.

item.title: Real Estate | September with more transactions and slight appreciation
item.description: Last month, there were a total of 247 housing transactions, an increase of 28 percent compared to last year. In Macau and Taipa the price per square meter is increasing, contrary to what happens in Coloane In September, the number of housing purchases and sales showed an annual growth of 28.0 percent, according to the most recent data released by the Financial Services Directorate (DSF). Last month, 247 transactions were registered, while in September 2024 there were 193 transactions, a difference of 54 movements. The most active market was the Macau Peninsula with 185 transactions, 66 more than last year, which represented a growth of 55.5 percent. In Taipa, 52 house sales were registered, 13 more than last year, when 39 were registered. Finally, in Coloane, 10 transactions were registered, a reduction of 25 sales compared to the same period last year. In August 2024, the registration of housing transactions in Coloane was abnormally high for the usual average. In terms of housing prices, the month of September was marked by a reduction in the square meter, compared to the same month in 2024, from 80,384 patacas to 75,655 patacas. This was an annual difference of 4,729 patacas or 5.9 percent. The average reduction resulted from the Coloane market, with the average price per square meter falling from 121,190 patacas to 72,180 patacas, a difference of 40.4 percent. However, in the Peninsula and Taipa prices increased. In Macau, the square meter increased in value in the space of one year from 68,187 patacas to 74,127 patacas. In Taipa, the increase was from 70,242 patacas to 80,454 patacas, an annual increase of 14.5 percent. Cheaper When the comparison is made between August and September, the number of transactions showed an increase of 12 movements, given that in August 235 transactions had been registered, a difference of 5.1 percent. The monthly comparison shows that Taipa and Coloane showed an increase in transactions, while in the Macau Peninsula there was a reduction. In Taipa, the number of purchases and sales increased from 37 transactions to 52 transactions, while in Coloane there was an increase from 6 to 10 transactions. In the Peninsula the reduction was from 185 transactions to 192 transactions. In terms of monthly price variation, September saw a devaluation of the average price per square meter of 5.9 percent, given that in August the value recorded was 80,370 patacas per square meter, a difference of 4,715 patacas. In August, on the Macau Peninsula the average price per square meter was 82,976 patacas, in Taipa 71,897 patacas and in Coloane 80,370 patacas per square meter.

item.title: Alcohol and Tobacco | More than four thousand infractions by September
item.description: Between January and September, the Health Services (SS) detected 4,054 violations of the Tobacco Control Law and the Alcohol Consumption Control Law. The information was released yesterday afternoon, through a statement from the organization led by Alvis Lo Iek Long. In relation to tobacco-related infractions, 3,744 cases of people smoking in prohibited places were detected, 196 cases of transporting electronic cigarettes when crossing borders, and 103 suspected cases of other infractions, which include situations of lack of signs prohibiting smoking or the lack of signs warning of the prohibition of the sale of tobacco products to minors under 18 years of age. In relation to the main locations of infractions, 842 cases (22.5 percent) occurred in casinos, 552 cases (14.7 percent) in restaurants, and 319 cases (8.5 percent) in parks/gardens and leisure areas. With regard to the control of alcohol consumption, between January and September 11 suspected cases of violation of the law were registered, with three cases related to the sale of drinks to minors. The remaining eight cases were due to various reasons, such as the lack of labels with warnings about the prohibition of selling or providing alcoholic beverages to minors, the lack of clear signage about the places reserved for the sale of alcoholic beverages or the lack of warnings in Chinese, Portuguese and English. The SS were also concerned about a case of a minor who managed to buy alcohol through an adult.

item.title: DSSCU | Installation of metal cages condemned
item.description: In reaction to several online advertisements offering cage installation services, the Soils and Urban Construction Services issued a statement warning that these are illegal works that should be avoided The Directorate of Land and Urban Construction Services (DSSCU) warns the population not to resort to installing metal cages, as they constitute an illegal practice. The alert was left yesterday, through a statement, following advertisements offering the service. According to the DSSCU “in recent days, advertisements promoting the provision of metal cage installation services” have been published on various social networks and online audiovisual platforms, considered “manifestly illegal acts”. For this reason, DSSCU “expresses its high concern and rejection of such practices, reiterating that the Government has been continuously combating illegal works, including metal cages”. The press release from the organization led by Lai Weng Leong also promises to combat, as a matter of priority, illegal works to install cages, illegal renovations, buildings in a dilapidated state, as well as illegal works in buildings with a use license. “DSSCU appeals to citizens not to commit legal infractions and to refrain from resorting to such metal cage installation services,” it was requested. At the same time, DSSCU is concerned about the “proliferation, on various audiovisual platforms and online social networks, of advertisements that, through short videos, actively promote the provision of metal cage installation services, with the aim of attracting customers and inducing citizens to carry out illegal works, putting public safety at risk”. The organization therefore asks citizens to actively contribute to the elimination of illegal constructions in order to help guarantee public safety. Fines of 240 thousand patacas Regarding the punishment for installing metal cages, DSSCU warns that it can lead to fines of MOP240,000, and that there has been at least one previous case in which a fine of this amount was imposed. “Among the cases dealt with by DSSCU in recent years, illegal works deserve special attention, namely metal cages commonly known as ‘overhanging balconies’, with fines being imposed reaching the amount of 180,000 patacas in one case and 240,000 patacas in another, relating to the installation of several metal cages in a single unit”, it was reported. The Government also points out that it will investigate the advertisements and that if the installation of cages in local buildings is confirmed, it will take the legally required measures. “Regarding the illegal works identified in the aforementioned advertisements, the DSSCU will carry out inspection and investigation actions, if the veracity of the facts is confirmed, a process will be opened for immediate monitoring”, it was pointed out.
